story.heading: We create clarity before you decide
story.intro: Tax decisions are rarely urgent – but almost always consequential. When facing important strategic decisions, you don't need quick answers, but well-founded assessments, clear strategies, and a partner who thinks ahead.
story.paragraph2: Many entrepreneurs come to us when traditional tax consulting is no longer sufficient. When structures grow, business areas become more complex, or international connections are added. When you need not just tax returns, but strategic structuring, risk assessment, and reliable concepts.
story.paragraph3: We often work with companies that already have holding structures, participations, or cross-border models – but don't fully utilize the tax potential or overlook risks. We analyze what exists, identify weaknesses, and develop solutions that work legally and make economic sense.
story.paragraph4: Additionally, we serve clients already on a path to success where tax consulting in the past was often reduced to routine declarations and structuring potentials were not recognized or utilized. This particularly includes high-growth entrepreneurs, influencers and bloggers with high reach, as well as clients with broad and dynamic business areas.
story.paragraph5: What distinguishes our firm is a structured, strategic, and procedurally secure working method as well as a high success rate – particularly in structuring issues, tax audits, contentious proceedings, and sensitive tax criminal law situations. Our focus is not on short-term individual measures, but on sustainable, legally secure solutions that withstand audit and liability considerations.
story.paragraph6: We also see ourselves as advisors to advisors. In complex or particularly sensitive matters, we are regularly called upon by tax advisors, auditors, and lawyers to assess specialized questions, develop structures, or technically secure planning.

philosophy.card1Text: You have a dedicated contact person – no rotation, no anonymity. We get to know your business and support you long-term.
philosophy.card2Text: We think ahead, inform you about legal changes, and identify optimization potential – not just on request.

hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.subtitle: Transparency from the start. Here you'll find answers to the most important questions about our approach, costs, and services.

q1.q: Who is your firm right for?
q1.a: We specialize in entrepreneurs, self-employed professionals, and freelancers with complex tax matters. Our focus areas include exit tax, e-commerce, healthcare professions, real estate, and corporate structures. If you're looking for proactive consulting on equal footing – not just annual tax returns – you're in the right place.

q2.a: Yes, absolutely. Many of our clients are located throughout Germany or abroad. We use modern tools for digital collaboration: video calls, cloud accounting, secure document transmission. Personal meetings are of course also possible – at our office in Düren or at your location.

q3.a: We work with DATEV for accounting and payroll – the industry standard for professional tax consulting. For digital collaboration, we use modern cloud solutions, secure document portals, and video conferencing. Collaboration is location-independent and efficient.

q4.q: How much does the initial consultation cost?
q4.a: The first consultation (30 minutes) is free of charge. We get to know each other, you describe your situation, and we clarify how we can help you. Only then will you receive a transparent offer – with no hidden costs.

q5.q: How does the initial consultation work?
q5.a: The initial consultation is non-binding and lasts approximately 30 minutes. We get to know each other, you describe your situation and questions. We give you an initial assessment and clarify whether and how we can work together. After that, you decide at your leisure whether you want to work with us.

q6.a: You don't need any documents for the initial consultation. A brief description of your situation is sufficient (e.g., "I'm planning to relocate abroad" or "I sell internationally on Amazon"). We'll discuss all details during the conversation. For specific projects, you're welcome to bring relevant documents, but it's not required.

q7.a: Our fees are based on the German Tax Consultant Fee Regulation (StBVV) or by individual agreement. For projects (e.g., exit tax consulting, structuring), we often offer flat rates – so you know from the start what to expect. For ongoing support, we work with monthly flat rates or based on actual effort. Transparency is important to us: you'll always receive a clear offer in advance.

q8.a: Yes, we offer flat rates for many services – for example, for annual financial statements, tax returns, or consulting projects. For ongoing support, we work with monthly fixed prices. This gives you planning security. We'll discuss this individually during the initial consultation.

q9.q: Will I have a dedicated contact person?
q9.a: Yes, absolutely. You have a dedicated tax consultant as your contact person – no rotation, no anonymity. Your tax consultant knows your business, your goals, and your situation. In case of absence (vacation, illness), a colleague will represent them – but your main contact person always remains the same.

q10.q: How quickly do you respond to inquiries?
q10.a: We typically respond within 24 hours (on business days). For urgent matters (e.g., ongoing audit, deadlines), often on the same day. You can reach us by phone Mon–Fri from 08:30–18:00.

q11.a: Yes, that's actually our standard. We use cloud accounting (DATEV), secure document portals, and video calls. Many of our clients work exclusively digitally with us – without ever having been on-site. Of course, you can also visit us personally in Düren if you prefer.

q12.q: Do you also handle ongoing bookkeeping?
q12.a: Yes. We handle financial accounting, payroll accounting, annual financial statements, and all tax returns – completely or as supplementary consulting to your internal team, as you wish. We adapt to your requirements.

q13.q: What is exit tax and who does it affect?
q13.a: Exit taxation (§ 6 AStG) affects individuals who leave Germany while holding shares in a corporation (e.g., GmbH). Upon exit, hidden reserves are taxed – even if no sale takes place. This mainly affects entrepreneurs, shareholders, and managing directors with GmbH shares. We advise you on strategies, deferral models, and tax alternatives.

q14.q: Do you also advise on e-commerce/Amazon?
q14.a: Yes, e-commerce and online trade are one of our focus areas. We advise on VAT for international platforms (Amazon, eBay, Shopify, etc.), OSS (One-Stop-Shop), FBA, dropshipping, structuring for growth, and much more. Whether you're just starting or already selling internationally – we help you grow tax-securely.

q15.q: Do you support during tax audits?
q15.a: Yes, absolutely. We accompany you throughout the entire tax audit: preparation, execution, final meeting, and objection if necessary. Our goal is for you to be well-prepared and experience no unpleasant surprises. If you've already received an audit notice, contact us quickly.

q16.q: Do you also advise on real estate?
q16.a: Yes. We advise on real estate in private and business assets, corporate models (GmbH & Co. KG, etc.), asset transfer, speculation periods, depreciation, and much more. Real estate is tax-wise highly complex – we develop solutions that fit your situation.

q17.q: Do you also support healthcare professions (doctors, pharmacies)?
q17.a: Yes, healthcare professions are one of our focus areas. We advise doctors, dentists, pharmacies, and MVZ on founding, corporate structures, real estate structures, succession planning, and ongoing support. Healthcare professions have special tax requirements – we know them.

q18.q: How quickly can I get an appointment?
q18.a: Usually within 3–5 business days. For urgent matters (e.g., tax audit, approaching deadlines), often even sooner. Just contact us – we'll find a solution.

q19.q: Do you also offer legal consulting?
q19.a: As tax consultants, we may offer legal consulting as an ancillary service according to § 5 Para. 1 RDG – i.e., legal consulting directly related to tax consulting (e.g., partnership agreements in a tax context). For complex legal questions, we work together with specialized attorneys.

q20.q: Do you also work with start-ups?
q20.a: Yes, gladly. We accompany you from founding to growth: choice of legal form, business registration, tax office registration, ongoing bookkeeping, tax returns. We have extensive experience especially with e-commerce start-ups, healthcare professions, or planned internationalization.

hero.title: Knowledge Tax Field Audit
hero.subtitle: What you should know about tax audits – process, rights and strategic support

wissen.intro: A tax field audit is a significant intervention for many entrepreneurs, self-employed professionals and freelancers. What often begins as a "routine audit" can quickly lead to back taxes, interest charges or even tax criminal law risks.

what.title: What is a tax field audit?
what.text1: The tax field audit is a legally regulated examination procedure in which the tax authorities comprehensively examine the tax affairs of a taxpayer. The legal basis is in particular §§ 193 ff. Tax Code (AO) and the tax audit regulations.
what.goal: Purpose of the field audit: Uniformity of taxation in compliance with the principle of proportionality.

whatIsChecked.title: What does the tax authority actually examine?
whatIsChecked.intro: As part of a tax field audit, the tax authorities do not limit themselves to a mere comparison of figures. Rather, they conduct a comprehensive business assessment in which economic processes, organizational structures and entrepreneurial decisions are comprehensively evaluated.

card1.title: Business Processes
card1.description: Workflows, responsibilities, purchasing and sales processes, warehousing

card2.title: Calculations & Prices
card2.description: Gross profit margins, goods input ratios, price comparisons

whoIsAudited.title: Who is audited – and how often?
whoIsAudited.intro: Field audits do not only affect large companies. The audit frequency depends on size classes, industry, irregularities and risk criteria of the tax authorities.
whoIsAudited.subtitle: Affected business forms:
whoIsAudited.item4: Entrepreneurs with cash management or cash transactions

step1.title: The audit order
step1.intro: Every field audit begins with an audit order. This must contain:
step1.warningText: The audit order is not a mere formality, but the first strategic starting point. Errors or ambiguities can already be legally challengeable here.

step2.title: Cooperation obligations
step2.description: The taxpayer is obliged to cooperate – but not without limits. In principle, the audit takes place on the taxpayer's business premises. Duration and scope must be oriented to the necessary measure.

step3.title: Data access and digital audit
step3.description: The tax authorities increasingly resort to digital evaluations (IDEA, key figure comparisons, time series analyses).

whenAllowed.title: When is an estimation permissible?
whenAllowed.item1: Bookkeeping shows formal or material deficiencies
whenAllowed.warningText: Not every formal deficiency automatically justifies a full estimation.

requirements.title: Requirements for a proper estimation
requirements.intro: Case law requires that an estimation:
requirements.note: Blanket or schematic surcharges are inadmissible.

benchmarks.title: Benchmark collections – limits and case law
benchmarks.intro: The tax authorities use industry-specific benchmark collections as reference values. However, these may not be applied mechanically.

principles.title: Central case law principles (BFH)
principles.item1: Benchmarks are guidance aids, not binding standards
principles.item2: Individual business characteristics must be considered
principles.item3: Statistical average values do not reflect business reality

ourApproach.title: Our approach: Individual case instead of statistics
ourApproach.intro: A tax field audit must not be "statistics taxation". We therefore consistently focus on:
ourApproach.item1: Elaboration of the individual business structure
ourApproach.item3: Argumentative classification of benchmarks and key figures in the concrete business context
ourApproach.goal: The goal is to replace blanket assumptions by the tax authorities with comprehensible, legally reliable individual case arguments.

howWeHelp.title: How we support you
howWeHelp.description: We comprehensively support our clients from the audit order to the lawsuit before the Federal Tax Court. Our focus is not on mere reaction, but on early structuring, legal classification and strategic negotiation with the tax authorities.

faq.q3: What is the German Tax Consultant Fee Regulation (StBVV)?
faq.a3: The StBVV legally regulates fees for tax services. It contains fee tables and ranges (from 1/10 to 10/10) within which tax consultants can set their compensation. We generally orient ourselves to the mid-range (5/10 to 6/10).

faq.a5: Usually monthly or quarterly. You receive a detailed invoice with a breakdown of services provided. This way you always keep track.
